member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment
member.summary: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory,System.Byte,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates an object that provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.
The intern factory to use when generating keys. When comparing two or more assemblies using TypeHelper, MemberHelper, etc. it is necessary to make the hosts use the same intern factory.

The size of a pointer on the runtime that is the target of the metadata units to be loaded into this metadta host. This parameter only matters if the host application wants to work out what the exact layout of a struct will be on the target runtime. The framework uses this value in methods such as TypeHelper.SizeOfType and TypeHelper.TypeAlignment. If the host application does not care about the pointer size it can provide 0 as the value of this parameter. In that case, the first reference to IMetadataHost.PointerSize will probe the list of loaded assemblies to find an assembly that either requires 32 bit pointers or 64 bit pointers. If no such assembly is found, the default is 32 bit pointers.
A collection of strings that are interpreted as valid paths which are used to search for units. May be null.
Whether the GAC (Global Assembly Cache) should be searched when resolving references.

requires.vb: pointerSize = Nothing OrElse pointerSize = 4 OrElse pointerSize = 8

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.AddLibPath(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new directory (path) to the list of search paths for which to look in when searching for a unit to load.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the assembly containing the Microsoft.Contracts.Contract, by asking each of the loaded units for its opinion on the matter and returning the opinion with the highest version number. If none of the loaded units have an opinion, the result is the same as CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetCoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the assembly containing the core system types such as System.Object, by asking each of the loaded units for its opinion on the matter and returning the opinion with the highest version number. If none of the loaded units have an opinion, the identity of the runtime executing the compiler itself is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetSystemCoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: Returns an identity that is the same as CoreAssemblyIdentity, except that the name is "System.Core" and the version is at least 3.5.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.FindAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Finds the assembly that matches the given identifier among the already loaded set of assemblies, or a dummy assembly if no matching assembly can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.FindModule(Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity)
member.summary: Finds the module that matches the given identifier among the already loaded set of modules, or a dummy module if no matching module can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.FindUnit(Microsoft.Cci.UnitIdentity)
member.summary: Finds the unit that matches the given identifier, or a dummy unit if no matching unit can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetLocalPath(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary: Returns the CodeBase of the named assembly (which is a URL), except if the URL has the file scheme. In that case the URL is converted to a local file path that can be used by System.IO.Path methods.
member.param: The name of the assembly whose location is desired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LoadAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: The assembly that matches the given reference, or a dummy assembly if no matching assembly can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LoadModule(Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity)
member.summary: The module that matches the given reference, or a dummy module if no matching module can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LoadUnit(Microsoft.Cci.UnitIdentity)
member.summary: The unit that matches the given identity, or a dummy unit if no matching unit can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LoadUnitFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the unit that is stored at the given location, or a dummy unit if no unit exists at that location or if the unit at that location is not accessible. Implementations should do enough caching to avoid repeating work: this method gets called very often for already loaded units as part of the probing logic.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetPlatformType
member.summary: Returns an object that provides a collection of references to types from the core platform, such as System.Object and System.String.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.GetTargetPlatformPointerSize
member.summary: Returns an opinion about the size of a pointer on the target runtime for the set of modules currently in this.unitCache. If none of the modules requires either 32 bit pointers or 64 bit pointers the result is 4 (i.e. 32 bit pointers). This method is only called if a host application has not explicitly provided the pointer size of the target platform.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.Probe(System.String,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Looks in the specified to see if a file exists, first with the extension "dll" and then with the extensions "winmd" and "exe". Returns null if not found, otherwise constructs a new AssemblyIdentity

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.ProbeAssemblyReference(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Given the identity of a referenced assembly (but not its location), apply host specific policies for finding the location of the referenced assembly. Returns an assembly identity that matches the given referenced assembly identity, but which includes a location. If the probe failed to find the location of the referenced assembly, the location will be "unknown://location".
member.param: The unit that is referencing the assembly. It will have been loaded from somewhere and thus has a known location, which will typically be probed for the referenced assembly.
The assembly being referenced. This will not have a location since there is no point in probing for the location of an assembly when you already know its location.
member.returns: An assembly identity that matches the given referenced assembly identity, but which includes a location. If the probe failed to find the location of the referenced assembly, the location will be "unknown://location".
member.remarks: Looks for the referenced assembly first in the same directory as the referring unit, then in any search paths provided to the constructor, then finally the GAC.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.ProbeModuleReference(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity)
member.summary: Given the identity of a referenced module (but not its location), apply host specific policies for finding the location of the referenced module.
member.param: The unit that is referencing the module. It will have been loaded from somewhere and thus has a known location, which will typically be probed for the referenced module.
Module being referenced.
member.returns: A module identity that matches the given referenced module identity, but which includes a location. If the probe failed to find the location of the referenced assembly, the location will be "unknown://location".
member.remarks: Default implementation of ProbeModuleReference. Override this method to change the behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.RegisterAsLatest(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit)
member.summary: Registers the given unit as the latest one associated with the unit's location. Such units can then be discovered by clients via GetUnit.
member.param: The unit to register.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.RemoveUnit(Microsoft.Cci.UnitIdentity)
member.summary: Removes the unit with the given identity. Returns true iff the unitIdentity is found in the loaded units.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.ReportErrors(Microsoft.Cci.ErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Errors event with the given error event arguments. The event is raised on a separate thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.SynchronousReportErrors(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises the Errors event with the given error event arguments.
member.param: The error event arguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.ReportError(Microsoft.Cci.IErrorMessage)
member.summary: Raises the CompilationErrors event with the given error wrapped up in an error event arguments object. The event is raised on a separate thread.
member.param: The error to report.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.unitCache
member.summary: A cache containing all of the units of metadata that have been loaded via this host. Entries may be added to this cache as a side effect of a metadata reader that lazily fills in the object model. As a result, any access to this cache must be protected by the global lock, as it cannot be assumed that all mutations to this object will happen during setup while the host object is exclusive to a single thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.UnifyAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Default implementation of UnifyAssembly. Override this method to change the behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.UnifyAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference)
member.summary: Default implementation of UnifyAssembly. Override this method to change the behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LibPaths
member.summary: A potentially empty list of directory paths that will be searched when probing for an assembly reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.SearchInGAC
member.summary: Sets or gets the boolean that determines if lookups of assemblies searches the GAC by default.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.Errors
member.summary: The errors reported by this event are discovered in background threads by an opend ended set of error reporters. Listeners to this event should thus be prepared to be called at abitrary times from arbitrary threads. Each occurrence of the event concerns a particular source location and a particular error reporter. The reported error collection (possibly empty) supercedes any errors previously reported by the same error reporter for the same source location. A source location can be an entire ISourceDocument, or just a part of it (the latter would apply to syntax errors discovered by an incremental parser after an edit to the source document).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.ContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly containing Microsoft.Contracts.Contract.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.CoreIdentities
member.summary: The set of identities that results from the individual opinions of all of the units loaded into this host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly containing the core system types such as System.Object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.SystemCoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the System.Core assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.InternFactory
member.summary: A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.LoadedUnits
member.summary: Returns enumeration of all the units loaded so far.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.NameTable
member.summary: A table used to intern strings used as names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of references to types from the core platform, such as System.Object and System.String.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.PointerSize
member.summary: The size (in bytes) of a pointer on the platform on which the host is targetting. The value of this property is either 4 (32-bits) or 8 (64-bit).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataHostEnvironment.PreserveILLocations
member.summary: True if IL locations should be preserved up into the code model by decompilers using this host.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.GlobalLock
member.summary: Static class encasulating the global lock object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.GlobalLock.LockingObject
member.summary: All synchronization code should exclusively use this lock object, hence making it trivial to ensure that there are no deadlocks. It also means that the lock should never be held for long. In particular, no code holding this lock should ever wait on another thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataReaderHost.GuessUnderlyingTypeSizeOfUnresolvableReferenceToEnum(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns a guess of the size of the underlying type of the given type reference to an enum type, which is assumed to be unresolvable because it is defined an assembly that is not loaded into this host. Successive calls to the method will cycle through these values with a periodicity determined by the number of types in the game and the successful guesses made in earlier games.
member.param: A type reference that cannot be resolved.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost
member.summary: A base class for an object provided by the application hosting the metadata reader. The object allows the host application to control how assembly references are unified, where files are found and so on. The object also controls the lifetime of things such as memory mapped files and blocks of unmanaged memory. Be sure to call Dispose on the object when it is no longer needed and the associated locks and/or memory must be released immediately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory,System.Byte,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates an object that provides an abstraction over the application hosting compilers based on this framework. Remember to call the Dispose method when the resulting object is no longer needed.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.
The intern factory to use when generating keys. When comparing two or more assemblies using TypeHelper, MemberHelper, etc. it is necessary to make the hosts use the same intern factory.

The size of a pointer on the runtime that is the target of the metadata units to be loaded into this metadta host. This parameter only matters if the host application wants to work out what the exact layout of a struct will be on the target runtime. The framework uses this value in methods such as TypeHelper.SizeOfType and TypeHelper.TypeAlignment. If the host application does not care about the pointer size it can provide 0 as the value of this parameter. In that case, the first reference to IMetadataHost.PointerSize will probe the list of loaded assemblies to find an assembly that either requires 32 bit pointers or 64 bit pointers. If no such assembly is found, the default is 32 bit pointers.
A collection of strings that are interpreted as valid paths which are used to search for units.
Whether the GAC (Global Assembly Cache) should be searched when resolving references.

requires.vb: pointerSize = Nothing OrElse pointerSize = 4 OrElse pointerSize = 8

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Finalize
member.summary: Calls IDiposable.Dispose on any disposable objects allocated by this host environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Dispose
member.summary: Calls IDiposable.Dispose on any disposable objects allocated by this host environment.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Close
member.summary: Calls IDiposable.Dispose on any disposable objects allocated by this host environment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.disposableObjectAllocatedByThisHost
member.summary: A list of all of the IDisposable object that have been allocated by this host.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.OpenBinaryDocument(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Open the binary document as a memory block in host dependent fashion. IMPORTANT: The lifetime of the memory block is the same as the lifetime of this host object. Be sure to call Dispose on the host object when it is no longer needed, otherwise files may stay locked, or resources such as large blocks of memory may remain allocated until the host's finalizer method runs.
member.param: The binary document that is to be opened.
member.returns: The unmanaged memory block corresponding to the source document.
member.remarks: When overridding this method, be sure to add any disposable objects to this.disposableObjectAllocatedByThisHost.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.OpenBinaryDocument(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument,System.String)
member.summary: Open the child binary document within the context of parent source document.as a memory block in host dependent fashion For example: in multimodule assemblies the main module will be parentSourceDocument, where as other modules will be child documents. IMPORTANT: The lifetime of the memory block is the same as the lifetime of this host object. Be sure to call Dispose on the host object when it is no longer needed, otherwise files may stay locked, or resources such as large blocks of memory may remain allocated until the host's finalizer method runs.
member.param: The source document indicating the child document location.
The name of the child document.
member.returns: The unmanaged memory block corresponding to the child document.
member.remarks: When overridding this method, be sure to add any disposable objects to this.disposableObjectAllocatedByThisHost.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Redirect(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference})
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to add, remove or substitute assembly references in the given list. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains these references.
The assembly references to substitute.
member.returns: Usually assemblyReferences, but occasionally a modified enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Redirect(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeReference)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute one named type reference for another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains the reference.
A named type reference encountered during metadata reading.
member.returns: Usually the value in typeReference, but occassionally something else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.ICustomAttribute)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute a custom attribute with another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains the custom attribute.
The custom attribute to rewrite (fix up).
member.returns: Usually the value in customAttribute, but occassionally another custom attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute one method definition for another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that is defines the method.
A method definition encountered during metadata reading.
member.returns: Usually the value in methodDefinition, but occassionally something else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.StartGuessingGame
member.summary: Called by the metadata reader when it is about to start parsing a custom attribute blob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.TryNextPermutation
member.summary: Called by the metadata reader when it has unsucessfully tried to parse a custom attribute blob and it now needs to try a new permutation. Returns false if no more perumations are possible.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.WinGuessingGame
member.summary: Called by the metadata reader when it has successfully parsed a custom attribute blob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderHost.GuessUnderlyingTypeSizeOfUnresolvableReferenceToEnum(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns a guess of the size of the underlying type of the given type reference to an enum type, which is assumed to be unresolvable because it is defined an assembly that is not loaded into this host. Successive calls to the method will cycle through these values with a periodicity determined by the number of types in the game and the successful guesses made in earlier games.
member.param: A type reference that cannot be resolved.

ensures.vb: result = 1 OrElse result = 2 OrElse result = 4 OrElse result = 8

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.MethodsAreEquivalent(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Returns true iff the two methods are identical (if they are both non-generic) or if they are equivalent modulo method generic type parameters (if they are both generic).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.GetImplicitlyImplementedInterfaceMethods(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Returns zero or more interface methods that are implemented by the given method. Only methods from interfaces that are directly implemented by the containing type of the given method are returned. Interfaces declared on base classes are always fully implemented by the base class, albeit sometimes by an abstract method that is itself implemented by a derived class method.
member.remarks: IMethodDefinitions are returned (as opposed to IMethodReferences) because it isn't possible to find the interface methods without resolving the interface references to their definitions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.QualifiedMethodNameBeginsWith(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: For event/property accessors, the name mihgt be "T.U.get_P", i.e., the "get_" doesn't necessarily come at the beginning of the name, but it always comes before the event/property name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.IsVisibleOutsideAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinitionMember)
member.summary: Decides if the given type definition member is visible outside of the assembly it is defined in. It does not take into account friend assemblies: the meaning of this method is that it returns true for those members that are visible outside of their defining assembly to *all* assemblies. It also does not take into account the unlikely case that a subtype of the type defining the given member may expose it outside the assembly via an explicit method implementation (taking that into account would require this method to traverse the entire defining assembly, which is expensive and should probably be done only by tools that are checking security properties).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.IsExplicitImplementationVisible(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns true if the given referenced method is not null and is explicitly implemented by the given type definition.
member.param: A possibly null reference to a method.
The type definition that contains the type member that is or contains the method reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemberHelper.IsVolatile(Microsoft.Cci.IFieldDefinition)
member.summary: Returns true if the field signature has the System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsVolatile modifier. Such fields should only be accessed with volatile reads and writes.
member.param: The field to inspect for the System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsVolatile modifier.

member.param: The type that defines or inherits the method to be returned.
A method reference whose name and signature matches that of the desired result.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.DummyArrayMethodReference
member.summary: A reference to a method used to access an array. These methods do not have definitions in metadata and cannot be resolved. At runtime any calls to these methods are turned into appropriate code sequences that may invoke helper methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.DummyArrayMethodReference.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IArrayTypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode,Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost)
member.summary: A reference to a method used to access an array. These methods do not have definitions in metadata and cannot be resolved. They do exist at runtime.
member.param: The type of array whose elements the referenced method will access.
The kind of access the method will provide. Must one of Array_Addr, Array_Createm, Array_Create_WithLowerBound, Array_Get or Array_Set.
Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.

requires.vb: arrayOperation = ((Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)65059) OrElse arrayOperation = ((Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)65055) OrElse arrayOperation = ((Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)65056) OrElse arrayOperation = ((Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)65057) OrElse arrayOperation = ((Microsoft.Cci.OperationCode)65058)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.Type
member.summary: The return type of the method or type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.Visibility
member.summary: Indicates if the member is public or confined to its containing type, derived types and/or declaring assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.AcceptsExtraArguments
member.summary: True if the call sites that references the method with this object supply extra arguments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.HasExplicitThisParameter
member.summary: True if this an instance method that explicitly declares the type and name of its first parameter (the instance).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.InternFactory
member.summary: A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsCil
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in the CLI Common Intermediate Language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsAggressivelyInlined
member.summary: True if the runtime is requested to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the runtime is not allowed to optimize this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.ReturnValueName
member.summary: The name of the parameter to which the return value is marshalled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericMethodInstance.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedTypeDefinitionMember`1.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedTypeDefinitionMember`1.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedEventDefinition.SpecializeIfConstructed(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Makes a copy of the given type reference, making sure that any references to this.partiallySpecializedVersion.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly, by this.partiallySpecializedVersion.Containing type are replaced with the equivalent reference to this.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly by this.ContainingType. Also replaces all references to type parameters of this.ContainingGenericTypeInstance with the corresponding type arguments.
member.param: A type reference obtained from some part of this.unspecializedVersion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedFieldReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the field definition that has been specialized to obtain the field definition referred to by this field reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized field definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized field reference refers to the corresponding field definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized field reference always refers to a field definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.summary: True if the type is a class (it is not an interface or type parameter and does not extend a special base class). Corresponds to C# class.

member.summary: True if the type is a delegate (it extends System.MultiCastDelegate). Corresponds to C# delegate

member.summary: True if the type is an enumeration (it extends System.Enum and is sealed). Corresponds to C# enum.

member.summary: True if this type is parameterized (this.GenericParameters is a non empty collection).

member.summary: True if the type is an interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.IsReferenceType
member.summary: True if the type is a reference type. A reference type is non static class or interface or a suitably constrained type parameter. A type parameter for which MustBeReferenceType (the class constraint in C#) is true returns true for this property as does a type parameter with a constraint that is a class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the type may not be subtyped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the type is an abstract sealed class that directly extends System.Object and declares no constructors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.IsValueType
member.summary: True if the type is a value type. Value types are sealed and extend System.ValueType or System.Enum. A type parameter for which MustBeValueType (the struct constraint in C#) is true also returns true for this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericParameter`1.IsStruct
member.summary: True if the type is a struct (its not Primitive, is sealed and base is System.ValueType).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsNeverInlined

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsAggressivelyInlined

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsPlatformInvoke

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeImplemented

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeInternal

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsSealed

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodDefinition.IsSpecialName

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedMethodReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the method definition that has been specialized to obtain the method definition referred to by this method reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized method definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized method reference refers to the corresponding method definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized method reference always refers to a method definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedParameterDefinition.CopyAndSpecialize(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Replace the references to type and generic method parameters in partiallySpecializedType with matching type and generic method arguments.
member.remarks:
For example: method Outer[A->int].Mid[T1 => T1+].bar1[T=>T+](T p1, T1 p2, A p3), where Outer[A->int] means a generic type instance obtained from Outer by substituting A with int, Outer[A->int].Mid[T1 => T1+] means a specialized nested type definition obtained from Outer[A->int].Mid by specializing Mid within Outer[A->int], in the process T1 is specialized to T1+.
T, type of p1, needs to be specialized to T+; T1, type of p2, needs to be specialized to T1+, and A needs to be instantiated to int.
Implementation involves a step of replacing references to type and generic method parameters with their matching specialized version for the aboved mentioned substitution to work.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedPropertyDefinition.CopyAndSpecialize(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Makes a copy of the given type reference, making sure that any references to this.partiallySpecializedVersion.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly, by this.partiallySpecializedVersion.Containing type are replaced with the corresponding reference to this.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly by this.ContainingType. Also replaces all references to type parameters of this.ContainingGenericTypeInstance with the corresponding type arguments.
member.param: A type reference obtained from some part of this.unspecializedVersion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates a reference to a .NET assembly.
member.param: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.
The identity of the referenced assembly.
True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

True if the referenced assembly contains types that describe objects that are neither COM objects nor objects that are managed by the CLR. Instances of such types are created and managed by another runtime and are accessed by CLR objects via some form of interoperation mechanism.

member.summary: The Assembly that contains this module. May be null if the module is not part of an assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.Culture
member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly reference. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.ContainsForeignTypes
member.summary: True if the referenced assembly contains types that describe objects that are neither COM objects nor objects that are managed by the CLR. Instances of such types are created and managed by another runtime and are accessed by CLR objects via some form of interoperation mechanism.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.HashValue
member.summary: The encrypted SHA1 hash of the persisted form of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this AssemblyReference instance.

ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the referenced module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.Name
member.summary: The name of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of the referenced assembly. Empty if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt an encrypted hash value stored in the assembly, which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value in order to verify the integrity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: The hashed 8 bytes of the public key of the referenced assembly. This is empty if the referenced assembly does not have a public key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.ResolvedAssembly
member.summary: The referenced assembly, or Dummy.Assembly if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.ResolvedModule
member.summary: The referenced module, or Dummy.Module if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.ResolvedUnit
member.summary: The referenced unit, or Dummy.Unit if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.UnifiedAssemblyIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the assembly reference to which this assembly reference has been unified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.UnitIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the unit reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AssemblyReference.Version
member.summary: The version of the referenced assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference
member.summary: A reference to a type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates a reference to a type.
member.param: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.
True if the type is an enumeration (it extends System.Enum and is sealed). Corresponds to C# enum.
True if the referenced type is a value type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.host
member.summary: Provides a standard abstraction over the applications that host components that provide or consume objects from the metadata model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.Resolve
member.summary: The type definition being referred to. In case this type was alias, this is also the type of the aliased type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.AliasForType
member.summary: If this type reference can be resolved and it resolves to a type alias, the resolution continues on to resolve the reference to the aliased type. This property provides a way to discover how that resolution proceeded, by exposing the alias concerned. Think of this as a version of ResolvedType that does not traverse aliases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns the unique interned key associated with the type. This takes unification/aliases/custom modifiers into account .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.IsAlias
member.summary: Indicates if this type reference resolved to an alias rather than a type

ensures.vb: result Implies Not Me Is Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.IsEnum
member.summary: True if the type is an enumeration (it extends System.Enum and is sealed). Corresponds to C# enum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.BaseTypeReference.IsValueType
member.summary: True if the type is a value type. Value types are sealed and extend System.ValueType or System.Enum. A type parameter for which MustBeValueType (the struct constraint in C#) is true also returns true for this property.

member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this IReference instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SystemDefinedStructuralType.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SystemDefinedStructuralType.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

members.member:
Returns a deep copy of a generic type instance reference. In the copy, every reference to a partially specialized type parameter defined by the partially specialized version of targetContainer or of one of targetContainer's parents (if the parent is a SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition and generic) will be replaced with the specialized type parameter, defined by targetContainer or its parents.
An array type reference to be deep copied. A specialized nested type definition whose or whose parents' (specialized) type parameters will replace the occurrences of matching type parameters in . /// An intern factory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericTypeInstance.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericMethodInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Specialize component type references of genericTypeInstance and (if necessary) return a new instance of the specialized version of genericTypeInstance.GenericType using the specialized type arguments. Specialization here means replacing any references to the generic type parameters of containingMethodInstance.GenericMethod with the corresponding values of containingMethodInstance.GenericArguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericTypeInstance.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Specialize the type arguments of genericTypeIntance and (if necessary) return a new instance of containingTypeInstance.GenericType using the specialized type arguments. Specialization means replacing any references to the type parameters of containingTypeInstance.GenericType with the corresponding values of containingTypeInstance.GenericArguments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericTypeInstance.DeepCopyTypeReferenceWRTSpecializedMethod(Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Specialize the type arguments of genericTypeIntance and (if necessary) return a new instance of containingTypeInstance.GenericType using the specialized type arguments. Specialization means replacing any references to the method type parameters of the partially specialized version of specializedMethodReference with the corresponding references to method type parameters of specializedMethodReference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedGenericTypeParameter.DefiningType
member.summary: The generic type that defines this type parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition
member.summary: A type definition that is a specialized nested type. That is, the type definition is a member of a generic type instance, or of another specialized nested type. It is specialized, because if it had any references to the type parameters of the generic type, then those references have been replaced with the type arguments of the instance. In other words, it may be less generic than before, and hence it has been "specialized".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INestedTypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.INestedTypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.GenericTypeInstance,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Allocates a type definition that is a specialized nested type. That is, the type definition is a member of a generic type instance, or of another specialized nested type. It is specialized, because if it had any references to the type parameters of the generic type, then those references have been replaced with the type arguments of the instance. In other words, it may be less generic than before, and hence it has been "specialized".
member.param: The most generic version of the nested type. In other words, the one that the programmer wrote. In persisted metadata, type references are always to instantiations of the unspecialized version, with all inherited type arguments repeated inside the reference.

If containingGenericTypeInstance is an instance of a specialized nested generic type, then its members already have been specialized as part of the specialization of the generic (template) type. In that case, partiallySpecializedVersion is different from unspecialized version. At any rate, the thing to actually specialize if partiallySpecializedVersion. unspecializedVersion is used mainly for mapping to the CLR PE file format.
The generic type instance that supplies the type arguments that will be substituted for type parameters to create the specialized nested type created by this construtor.
The actual type that contains the specialized member constructed by this constructor. It can either be a generic type instance, or specialized nested type.
The intern factory to use for computing the interned identity of this type and any types and members referenced by it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition.CopyAndSpecialize(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Makes a copy of the given type reference, making sure that any references to this.partiallySpecializedVersion.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly, by this.partiallySpecializedVersion.Containing type are replaced with the equivalent reference to this.ContainingType or something defined, directly or indirectly by this.ContainingType. Also replaces all references to type parameters of this.ContainingGenericTypeInstance with the corresponding type arguments.
member.param: A type reference obtained from some part of this.unspecializedVersion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(INestedTypeDefinition).

member.summary: Zero or more classes from which this type is derived. For CLR types this collection is empty for interfaces and System.Object and populated with exactly one base type for all other types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.TypeDefinition.DeepCopyTypeReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of partiallySpecializedTypeReference. In the copy, every reference to a partially specialized type parameter of targetContainer or of one of targetContainer's parents (if the parent is a SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition and generic) is replaced with the specialized type parameter defined by targetContainer or its parents.
member.remarks:
The deep copy happens when we create a specialized member, such as a specialized method, property, field, parameters and so on. We must obtain a copy of any type reference in the member, which should not share nodes with the original type reference (called the partially specialized version) if the node contains generic parameters that may get specialized. Without such a copy, the instantiation of a generic type or method will not work. In the new copy, the references to (partially specialized) generic parameters must be replaced by the specialized version defined by the specialized parents of the specialized member.
For example, consider A[int].B[T1 => T1+], where A[int] is a generic type instance which contains a specialized nested type B, which has a generic type parameter T1 that is specialized to T1+. Now any type reference inside B[T1=>T1+], such as types of fields, methods, properties, and so on, must be copied and have any reference to T1 replaced by T1+.
Similar deep copy happens when specializing a method definition. .
member.param: A type reference to be deep copied.
A specialized nested type definition whose or whose parents' (specialized) type parameters will replace the occurrences of matching type parameters in partiallySpecializedTypeReference.
An intern factory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.TypeDefinition.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericMethodInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: If the given partially specialized type reference is a constructed type, such as an instance of IArrayTypeReference or IPointerTypeReference or IGenericTypeInstanceReference or INestedTypeReference, then return a new instance (if necessary) in which all refererences to the type parameters of containingMethodInstance.GenericMethod.GenericParameters have been replaced with the corresponding values from containingMethodInstance.GenericArguments. If the type is not a constructed type the method just returns the type. For the purpose of this method, an instance of IGenericParameter is regarded as a constructed type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.TypeDefinition.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: If the given partially specialized type reference is a constructed type, such as an instance of IArrayType or IPointerType or IGenericTypeInstance or INestedTypeReference, then return a new instance (if necessary) in which all refererences to the type parameters of containingTypeInstance.GenericType have been replaced with the corresponding values from containingTypeInstance.GenericArguments. If the type is not a constructed type the method just returns the type. For the purpose of this method, an instance of IGenericTypeParameterReference is regarded as a constructed type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.TypeDefinition.DeepCopyTypeReferenceWRTSpecializedMethod(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Make a copy of partiallySpecializedTypeReference so that the references to the partially specialized version of generic parameters defined in specializedMethodDefinition and its containing specialized nested type definition (if any) are replaced with the specialized version.
member.remarks:
Consider specialized method A[T1 -> T1].B[T2=> T2+].bar[T3 => T3+], where A[T1->T1] is the generic instance obtained from A using its generic parameter as the generic argument, A[T1->T1].B[T2=>T2+] is a specialized nested type whose containing type is A[T1->T1] and whose generic type parameter T2 is specialized to T2+, and bar[T3=>T3] is further a specialized member of A[T1->T1].B[T2=>T2+] with its generic parameter T3 specialized to T3+.
Suppose bar has a parameter whose type is X[T2, T3] for some generic type X. The corresponding parameter of of A[T1 -> T1].B[T2=> T2+].bar[T3 => T3+] is "specialized". The specialized parameter's type will participate future resolution and should not share nodes that may have been specialized with the original type reference X[T2, T3] (called partially specialized version). We must obtain a copy of the partially specialized version in which we replace the references of T2, T3 with their corresponding specialized versions, namely T2+ and T3+.

members.member:
Returns a deep copy the array type reference. In the copy, every reference to a partially specialized type parameter defined by the partially specialized version of targetContainer or of one of targetContainer's parents (if the parent is a SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition and generic) will be replaced with the specialized type parameter, defined by targetContainer or its parents.
An array type reference to be deep copied. A specialized nested type definition whose or whose parents' (specialized) type parameters will replace the occurrences of matching type parameters in . /// An intern factory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.Vector.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.IArrayTypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericMethodInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: If the given vector has an element type that involves a type parameter from the generic method from which the given method was instantiated, then return a new vector using an element type that has been specialized with the type arguments of the given generic method instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.Vector.SpecializeIfConstructedFromApplicableTypeParameter(Microsoft.Cci.IArrayTypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.IGenericTypeInstanceReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: If the given vector has an element type that involves a type parameter from the generic type from which the given type was instantiated, then return a new vector using an element type that has been specialized with the type arguments of the given generic type instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.Vector.DeepCopyTypeReferenceWRTSpecializedMethod(Microsoft.Cci.IArrayTypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: If the given vector has an element type that involves a method type parameter from the partially specialized version of specializedMethodReference, then return a new vector using an element type that is the corresponding method type parameter from specializedMethodDefinition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.BaseMetadataTraverser.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Use this routine, rather than ITypeReference.Dispatch, to call the appropriate derived overload of an ITypeReference. The former routine will call Visit(INamespaceTypeDefinition) rather than Visit(INamespaceTypeReference), etc., in the case where a definition is used as a reference to itself.
member.param: A reference to a type definition. Note that a type definition can serve as a reference to itself.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser
member.summary: A class that traverses the metadata model in depth first, left to right order, calling visitors on each model instance in pre-order as well as post-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.#ctor
member.summary: A class that traverses the metadata model in depth first, left to right order, calling visitors on each model instance in pre-order as well as post-order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.objectsThatHaveAlreadyBeenTraversed
member.summary: A table in which we record the traversal of objects that can be reached several times (because they are references or can be referred to) so that we can avoid traversing them more than once.
