member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.PreorderVisitor
member.summary: A visitor that should be called on each object being traversed, before any of its children are traversed. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.PostorderVisitor
member.summary: A visitor that should be called on each object being traversed, after all of its children are traversed. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.StopTraversal
member.summary: If this is true, the traverser will stop the traversal. Typically this is set by a Visit and causes the traversal to terminate immediately after the Visit method returns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataTraverser.TraverseIntoMethodBodies
member.summary: If this is true, the traversal descends into method bodies. If false, method bodies are ignored.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType
member.summary: Represents CLR Operand stack types

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Int32
member.summary: Operand stack is 32 bit value. It will be treated independent of sign on the stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Int64
member.summary: Operand stack is 64 bit value. It will be treated independent of sign on the stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.NativeInt
member.summary: Operand stack is platform dependent int value. It will be treated independent of sign on the stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Float
member.summary: Operand stack represents a real number. It can be converted to either float or double.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Reference
member.summary: Operand stack is a reference to some type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Object
member.summary: Operand stack is a reference or value type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Pointer
member.summary: Operand stack is a pointer type

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType.Invalid
member.summary: Operand stack is of invalid type

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper
member.summary: Helper class to get CLR Type manipulation information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.ClrOperandStackTypeFor(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Gives the Clr operand stack type corresponding to the typeDefinition

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.ClrOperandStackTypeFor(Microsoft.Cci.PrimitiveTypeCode)
member.summary: Gives the Clr operand stack type corresponding to the PrimitiveTypeCode

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.PrimitiveTypeCodeFor(Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType)
member.summary: Gives the primitive type code corresponding to the ClrOperandStackType

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.ConversionPossible(Microsoft.Cci.ClrOperandStackType,Microsoft.Cci.PrimitiveTypeCode)
member.summary: Conversion is possible from value stored on stack of type ClrOpernadStackType to given PrimitiveTypeCode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.AddResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of add operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.DivMulRemResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of division, multiplication and reminder operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.SubResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of substraction operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.UnaryResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of negation and not operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.CompResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of comparision operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.EqCompResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of equality comparision operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.IntOperationResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of integer operation (bitwise and, or, xor) with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.ShiftOperationResult
member.summary: Table representing the result of bit shift operation with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ClrHelper.ImplicitConversionPossibleArr
member.summary: Table representing the implicit conversion for the purpose of method calls with respect to ClrOperand stack.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions
member.summary: Options that specify how type and namespace member names should be formatted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.None
member.summary: Format the name with default options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.ContractNullable
member.summary: If the type is an instance of System.Nullable<T> format it using a short form, such as T?.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.DocumentationId
member.summary: Format for a unique id string like the ones generated in XML reference files. To generate a truly unique and compliant id, this option should not be used in conjunction with other NameFormattingOptions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.DocumentationIdMemberKind
member.summary:
Prefix the kind of member or type to the name. For example "T:System.AppDomain" or "M:System.Object.Equals".
Full list of prefixes: "T:" = Type, "M:" = Method, "F:" = Field, "E:" = Event, "P:" = Property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.EmptyTypeParameterList
member.summary: Include empty type parameter lists with the names of generic types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.EscapeKeyword
member.summary: If the name of the member is the same as keyword, format the name using the keyword escape syntax. For example: "@if" rather than just "if".

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.FormattingForDocumentationId
member.summary: Perform multiple miscellaneous formatting changes needed for a documentation id. This option does not perform all formatting necessary for a documentation id; instead use the option for a complete id string like the ones generated in XML reference files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.MemberKind
member.summary: Prefix the kind of member or type to the name. For example "class System.AppDomain".

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.MethodConstraints
member.summary: Include the type constraints of generic methods in their names.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.Modifiers
member.summary: Include modifiers, such as "static" with the name of the member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitContainingNamespace
member.summary: Do not include the name of the containing namespace in the name of a namespace member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitContainingType
member.summary: Do not include the name of the containing type in the name of a type member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitCustomModifiers
member.summary: Do not include optional and required custom modifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitImplementedInterface
member.summary: If the type member explicitly implements an interface, do not include the name of the interface in the name of the member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitTypeArguments
member.summary: Do not include type argument names with the names of generic type instances.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.OmitWhiteSpaceAfterListDelimiter
member.summary: Don't insert a space after the delimiter in a list. For example (one,two) rather than (one, two).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.ParameterName
member.summary: Include the names of parameters in the signatures of methods and indexers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.ParameterModifiers
member.summary: Include modifiers such as "ref" and "out" in the signatures of methods and indexers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.PreserveSpecialNames
member.summary: Do not transform special names such as .ctor and get_PropertyName into language specific notation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.ReturnType
member.summary: Include the name of the return types in the signatures of methods and indexers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.Signature
member.summary: Include the parameter types and optionally additional information such as parameter names.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.SmartTypeName
member.summary: Include the name of the containing type only if it is needed because of ambiguity or hiding. Include only as much as is needed to resolve this. Please note: this needs source level information to implement. The default formatters in MetdataHelper ignore this bit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.SmartNamespaceName
member.summary: Include the name of the containing namespace only if it is needed because of ambiguity or hiding. Include only as much as is needed to resolve this. Please note: this needs source level information to implement. The default formatters in MetdataHelper ignore this bit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.SupressAttributeSuffix
member.summary: Do not include the "Attribute" suffix in the name of a custom attribute type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.TypeConstraints
member.summary: Include the type parameter constraints of generic types in their names.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.TypeParameters
member.summary: Include type parameters names with the names of generic types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.UseGenericTypeNameSuffix
member.summary: Append `n where n is the number of type parameters to the type name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.UseGlobalPrefix
member.summary: Prepend "global::" to all namespace type names whose containing namespace is not omitted, including the case where the namespace type name qualifies a nested type name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.UseReflectionStyleForNestedTypeNames
member.summary: Use '+' instead of '.' to delimit the boundary between a containing type name and a nested type name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.UseTypeKeywords
member.summary: If the type corresponds to a keyword use the keyword rather than the type name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.NameFormattingOptions.Visibility
member.summary: Include the visibility of the member in its name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper
member.summary: Helper class for computing information from the structure of ITypeDefinition instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.BaseClass(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns the Base class. If there is no base type it returns null.
member.param: The type whose base class is to be returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.CanAccess(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinitionMember)
member.summary: True if the given type member may be accessed by (code in) the type definition. For example, if the member is private and the type definition is the containing type of the member, or is a nested type of the containing type of the member, the result is true. If the member is internal and the type is defined in a different assembly, then the result is false.
member.param: The type definition from which one wants to access the .
The type member to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.CanAccess(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: True if the given type (i.e., code within that type) may access the type .
member.param: The type definition from which one wants to access the .
The type to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.EffectiveBaseClass(Microsoft.Cci.IGenericParameter)
member.summary: Returns the most derived common base class that all types that satisfy the constraints of the given generic parameter must derive from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsCompilerGenerated(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns true if the given type, one of its containing types, has the System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerGeneratedAttribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsEmbeddedInteropType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns true if the given type, one of its containing types, has the System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TypeIdentifierAttribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsCompileTimeConstantType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true a value of this type can be treated as a compile time constant. Such values need not be stored in memory in order to be representable. For example, they can appear as part of a CLR instruction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsOpen(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the given type is a generic parameter or if it is a structural type that contains a reference to a generic parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsPrimitiveInteger(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR allows integer operators to be applied to values of the given type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsSignedPrimitiveInteger(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR allows signed integer operators to be applied to values of the given type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsSignedPrimitive(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR allows signed comparison operators to be applied to values of the given type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsUnsignedPrimitiveInteger(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR allows unsigned integer operators to be applied to values of the given type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsUnsignedPrimitive(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR allows unsigned comparison operators to be applied to values of the given type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsVisibleOutsideAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Decides if the given type definition is visible to assemblies other than the assembly it is defined in (and other than its friends).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.IsVisibleToFriendAssemblies(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Decides if the given type definition would visible to an assembly listed in an InternalsVisibleTo attribute of the assembly defining the given type. It is not necessary for the assembly to actually have such an attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.MergedType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: If both type references can be resolved, this returns the merged type of two types as per the verification algorithm in CLR. Otherwise it returns either type1, or type2 or System.Object, depending on how much is known about either type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.MergedType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns the merged type of two types as per the verification algorithm in CLR. If the types cannot be merged, then it returns System.Object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GenericInstanceVisibilityAsTypeMemberVisibility(Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference})
member.summary: Returns the most accessible visibility that is not greater than the given visibility and the visibilities of each of the given typeArguments. For the purpose of computing the intersection, namespace types are treated as being TypeMemberVisibility.Public or TypeMemberVisibility.Assembly. Generic type instances are treated as having a visibility that is the intersection of the generic type's visibility and all of the type arguments' visibilities.

requires.csharp: for all x in typeArguments x != null
requires.vb: for all x in typeArguments x <> Nothing

member.requires: for all x in typeArguments x != null

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.TypeVisibilityAsTypeMemberVisibility(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns a TypeMemberVisibility value that corresponds to the visibility of the given type definition. Namespace types are treated as being TypeMemberVisibility.Public or TypeMemberVisibility.Assembly. Generic type instances are treated as having a visibility that is the intersection of the generic type's visibility and all of the type arguments' visibilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.UninstantiateAndUnspecialize(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: If the given type is a generic type instance, return the unspecialized version of the generic type. If the given type is a specialized nested type, return its unspecialized version. Otherwise just return the type itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.Unspecialize(Microsoft.Cci.INestedTypeReference)
member.summary: If the given type is a specialized nested type, return its unspecialized version. Otherwise just return the type itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.VisibilityIntersection(Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility,Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility)
member.summary: Returns a TypeMemberVisibility value that is as accessible as possible while being no more accessible than either of the two given visibilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetDefiningNamespace(Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns the most nested unit namespace that encloses the given named type definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetDefiningUnit(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Returns the unit that defines the given type. If the type is a structural type, such as a pointer the result is the defining unit of the element type, or in the case of a generic type instance, the definining type of the generic template type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetDefiningUnitReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the unit that defines the given type. If the reference type is a reference to a structural type, such as a pointer the result is the a reference to the defining unit of the element type, or in the case of a generic type instance, the definining type of the generic template type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetEvent(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Returns an event of the given declaring type that has the given name. If no such event can be found, Dummy.EventDefinition is returned.
member.param: The type thats declares the event.
The name of the event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetField(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Returns a field of the given declaring type that has the given name. If no such field can be found, Dummy.FieldDefinition is returned.
member.param: The type thats declares the field.
The name of the field.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetField(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IFieldReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a field of the given declaring type that has the same name and signature as the given field reference. If no such field can be found, Dummy.FieldDefinition is returned.
member.param: The type thats declares the field.
A reference to the field.
True if type references should be resolved during signature matching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.GetMethod(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IName,Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference[])
member.summary: Returns a method of the given declaring type that has the given name and that matches the given parameter types. If no such method can be found, Dummy.MethodDefinition is returned.
member.param: The type that declares the method to be returned.
The name of the method.
A list of types that should correspond to the parameter types of the returned method.

member.summary: Try to compute the self instance of a type, that is, a fully instantiated and specialized type reference. For example, use T and T1 to instantiate A<T>.B.C<T1>. If successful, result is set to a IGenericTypeInstance if type definition is generic, or a specialized nested type reference if one of the parent of typeDefinition is generic, or typeDefinition if none of the above. Failure happens when one of its parent's members is not properly initialized.
member.param: A type definition whose self instance is to be computed.
The self instantiated reference to typeDefinition. Valid only when returning true.
member.returns: True if the instantiation succeeded. False if typeDefinition is a nested type and we cannot find such a nested type definition in its parent's self instance.

member.summary: Returns the most derived base class that both given types have in common. Returns null if no such class exists. For example: if either or both are interface types, then the result is null. A class is considered its own base class for this algorithm, so if type1 derives from type2 the result is type2 and if type2 derives from type1 the result is type1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.SizeOfType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)
member.summary: Returns the computed size (number of bytes) of a type. May call the SizeOf property of the type. Use SizeOfType(ITypeReference, bool) to suppress the use of the SizeOf property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.SizeOfType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the computed size (number of bytes) of a type.

If true the SizeOf property of the given type may be evaluated and used as the result of this routine if not 0. Remember to specify false for this parameter when using this routine in the implementation of the ITypeDefinition.SizeOf property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.TypeHelper.StackType(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.UnitSet

member.summary: Constructs a unit set made up of the given (non empty) list of units.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.UnitSet.Contains(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit)
member.summary: Determines if the given unit belongs to this set of units.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.UnitSet.Units
member.summary: Enumerates the units making up this set of units.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.UnitSet.UnitSetNamespaceRoot
member.summary: A unified root namespace for this set of units. It contains nested namespaces as well as top level types and anything else that implements INamespaceMember.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2
member.summary: A namespace definition whose members are aggregations of the members of a collection of containers of the given container type.
member.typeparam: The type of container that provides the members (or parts of members) for this namespace. For example NamespaceDeclaration.
The base type for members supplied by the container. For example IAggregatableNamespaceDeclarationMember.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedScope`3
member.summary: A scope whose members are aggregations of the members of a collection of "containers". For example, a symbol table type definition whose members are the aggregations of the members of a collection of source type declarations.
member.typeparam: The base type for members of the aggregated scope. For example ITypeDefinitionMember.
The type of container that provides the members (or parts of members) for this scope. For example ITypeDeclaration.
The base type for members supplied by the container. For example ITypeDeclarationMember.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedScope`3.AddContainerMemberToCache(`2)
member.summary: Takes a container member, gets a corresponding aggregated member for it and adds the latter to the member collection of this scope (if necessary). Usually, the container member is added to the declarations collection of the aggregated member. This behavior is overridable. See GetAggregatedMember.
member.param: The container member to aggregate. The aggregation gets cached and shows up in the Members collection of this scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedScope`3.AddContainer(`1)
member.summary: Adds all of the members of the given container to this scope, after aggregating the members with members from other containers.
member.param: A collection of members to aggregate with members from other containers and add to the members collection of this scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedScope`3.GetAggregatedMember(`2)
member.summary: Finds or creates an aggregated member instance corresponding to the given member. Usually this should result in the given member being added to the declarations collection of the aggregated member.
member.param: The member to aggregate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Allocates a namespace definition whose members are aggregations of the members of a collection of containers of the given container type.
member.param: The name of this namespace definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.Name
member.summary: The name of this namespace definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.RootOwner
member.summary: The object associated with the namespace. For example an IUnit or IUnitSet instance. This namespace is either the root namespace of that object or it is a nested namespace that is directly of indirectly nested in the root namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Immutable.AggregatedNamespace`2.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MemoryMappedFile
member.summary: A managed wrapper for an unmanaged memory mapped file. Important: each instance of this class holds a read-lock on a file. Instances should be explicitly disposed as soon as they become inactive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemoryMappedFile.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer for the Memory mapped file. Calls the CloseMap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemoryMappedFile.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the memory mapped file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MemoryMappedFile.CreateMemoryMappedFile(System.String,Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Factory method for opening the memory mapped file. The content of the map is assumed to come from localFileName. This can throw FileLoadException in case of error.
member.param: Name of the file from where the binary document needs to be opened. This is useful in case we want to copy the file to temporary location and then open or when we want to open document on the network.
The binary document for which the memory mapping is requested.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock
member.summary: A managed wrapper for a block of memory allocated from the unmanaged heap. Important: each instance of this class holds a read-lock on a file. Instances should be explicitly disposed as soon as they become inactive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock.Finalize
member.summary: Frees the umanaged memory block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the umanaged memory block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock.CreateUnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock(System.String,Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Creates an unmanaged binary memory block and copies the contents of the file at the given location into the block.
member.param: The path to the file to read.
The binary document whose contents are stored in the given file.
member.exception: localFileName is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters. -or- localFileName refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment.
localFileName refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in a non-NTFS environment.
The file specified by localFileName does not exist.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The file cannot be be read, for example because it is already being accessed exclusively by another process.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock.CreateUnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock(System.IO.Stream,Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Creates an unmanaged binary memory block and copies the contents of the given stream into the block.
member.param: A stream of bytes that are to be copied into the resulting memory block.
The binary document whose contents are stored in the given file.
member.exception: The length of the stream is not the same as the length of the binary document, or the stream length is greater than Int32.MaxValue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.UnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock.CreateUnmanagedBinaryMemoryBlock(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte},Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Creates an unmanaged binary memory block and copies the contents of the given byte enumeration into the block.
member.param: A stream of bytes that are to be copied into the resulting memory block.
The binary document whose contents are stored in the given file.
member.exception: The length of the stream is not the same as the length of the binary document, or the stream length is greater than Int32.MaxValue.

member.summary: Traverses the security attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ValidatingTraverser.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition)
member.summary: Traverses the specified type definition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError
member.summary: An enumeration of errors that can occur in a metadata model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.AbstractMethodMayNotBeSealedPlatformInvokeOrForwardReference
member.summary: An abstract method may not be marked as being sealed or as a platform invoke method or as being a forward reference.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.AbstractMethodsMustBeVirtual
member.summary: An abstract method must be marked as being virtual.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.AccessorListInconsistent
member.summary: An event's (property's) accessor list must be consistent with its Adder/Remover/Caller (Getter/Setter).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.AliasedTypeDoesNotBelongToAModule
member.summary: The type referenced by this alias does not come from a module of this assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ArraysMarshalledToFieldsCannotSpecifyElementCountParameter
member.summary: It makes no sense for the marshalling information for a field to specify which parameter to use for the element count of an array value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.AutoLayoutTypesCannotSpecifySize
member.summary: The size of a type can only be specified if the type does not have its LayoutKind set to Auto.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ConstantFieldMustBeStatic
member.summary: This field is a compile time constant but it is not marked as static.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ConstraintMayNotBeVoid
member.summary: A constraint on a generic parameter may not reference System.Void.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ConstructorInInterface
member.summary: Constructor methods may not be members of interface types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ConstructorsMustNotReturnValues
member.summary: Constructor methods may not return values. I.e. their return type must be System.Void.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ContainingAliasNotListedInExportedTypes
member.summary: This type alias is referenced as the parent of an exported type alias, but does not itself appear in the ExportedTypes property of the assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ContainingNamespaceDefinitionNotVisited
member.summary: This namespace member is being visited before its parent is being visited, which can only happen if its ContainingNamespace value is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ContainingTypeDefinitionNotVisited
member.summary: This type member is being visited before its parent is being visited, which can only happen if its ContainingTypeDefinition value is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.CustomAttributeConstructorIsBadReference
member.summary: The custom attribute's Constructor property references a method that resolves to something other than a constructor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.CustomAttributeTypeIsNotConstructorContainer
member.summary: The Type of the custom attribute is not the same as the containing type of the custom attribute's Constructor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DeclarativeSecurityOnInterfacesIsIgnored
member.summary: Declarative security annotations on interface types are ignored by the CLR.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DerivedTypeHasDifferentLayoutFromBaseType
member.summary: A derived type with LayoutKind other than Auto must have the same LayoutKind as its base type, unless its base type is System.Object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateAssemblyReference
member.summary: The module's assembly references list contains a duplicate entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateConstraint
member.summary: This constraint has already been encountered during the traversal of its defining generic parameters' Constraints collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateDefinition
member.summary: This definition has already been encountered during the traversal of the module being validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateEvent
member.summary: This event is listed more than once, or has the same name as another event of its containing type definition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateEntryInAllTypes
member.summary: The list of types returned by calling GetAllTypes on the module being validated contains a duplicate entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateField
member.summary: This field is listed more than once, or has the same name and signature as another field of its containing type definition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateFileReference
member.summary: This file reference instance occurs more than once, or has the same file name as another file reference in the Files collection of its contaiing assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateGenericTypeParameter
member.summary: This generic type parameter occurs more than once, or has the same InternedKey as another type parameter, in the GenericParameters collection of its defining type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateInterface
member.summary: This interface occurs more than once, or there is another interface with the same InternedKey, in the Interfaces collection of the type definition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateMethod
member.summary: This method occurs more than once, or there is another method with the same InternedKeay, in the Methods collection of its type definition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateMethodGenericTypeParameter
member.summary: This generic method type parameter occurs more than once, or has the same InternedKey as another type parameter, in the GenericParameters collection of its defining method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.DuplicateResource
member.summary: This resource reference occurs more than once, or there is another reference with the same name, in the Resources collection of the assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EmptyName
member.summary: This node may not have an empty name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EnumerationCountIsInconsistentWithCountProperty
member.summary: The actual number of elements is not the same as the number of elements specified by the {0} property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EnumDoesNotHaveAnInstanceField
member.summary: An enum type must have a single instance field of an integral type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EnumInstanceFieldNotUnique
member.summary: An enum type may only have a single instance field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EnumInstanceFieldTypeNotIntegral
member.summary: The instance field of an enum must be of an integral type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EventPropertyNamingPatternWarning
member.summary: The method used for an event/property accessor should follow the standard naming patterns.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.EventTypeMustBeClass
member.summary: The type of an event may not be an interface or a value type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ExportedTypeBelongsToManifestModule
member.summary: This type alias references a type that is defined in the module that contains the assembly manifest. The public types of such modules are already exported and should not be explicitly exported via the ExportedTypes collection of the assembly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ExplicitOverrideDoesNotMatchSignatureOfOverriddenMethod
member.summary: This method implementation (or explicit override) has an implemeting method that does not match the signature of the implemented method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.FieldMayNotBeConstantAndReadonly
member.summary: A field may not be both a compile time constant and readonly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.FieldOffsetNotNaturallyAlignedForObjectRef
member.summary: The offset of this field must be naturally aligned because its value is an object reference.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.FieldReferenceResolvesToDifferentField
member.summary: This field reference resolves to a field definition with a different InternedKey value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.GenericConstructor
member.summary: This method is a constructor but is also generic. That is not allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.GenericParameterCountDoesNotMatchGenericParameters
member.summary: The value of GenericParameterCount does not match the number of parameters in the GenericParameters collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.GetAllTypesIsIncomplete
member.summary: A type definition is being visited that is not an element of the list returned by calling GetAllTypes on the module being validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.GlobalFieldNotStatic
member.summary: This global field is not marked static.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.IncompleteNode
member.summary: The node has not been fully initialized. Property {0} has a dummy value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InitLocalsMustBeTrueIfLocalVariables
member.summary: Peverify complains if init locals is not set but there are local variables.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InstanceConstructorMayNotBeStatic
member.summary: An instance constructor (a method with the name .ctor) may not be marked as static. After all, it is supposed initialize its this object...

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidAlignment
member.summary: The given type alignment, {0}, is invalid. A valid alignment is one of 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidCulture
member.summary: The assembly culture string "{0}" does not match one of the strings allowed by the specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidCustomModifier
member.summary: Only references to named types may appear in custom modifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidGlobalFieldVisibility
member.summary: This global field has a visibility that only makes sense for type members.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidMetadataConstant
member.summary: The value of a IMetadataConstant instance must be a bool, char, number, string, or a null object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidMetadataFormatVersionForGenerics
member.summary: Bad module metadata format version. Found '{0}', should be at least 2.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidPInvokeCallingConvention
member.summary: The PInvokeCallingConvention property

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidSecurityAction
member.summary: The security action value is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.InvalidTypeMemberVisibility
member.summary: The value of the ITypeMember.Visibility is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MappedFieldDoesNotHaveAValidType
member.summary: This field is mapped to a static data area in its PE file, but its type is not a value type or it has fields that are not public or that contain pointers into the managed heap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MarshalledArraysMustHaveSizeKnownAtCompileTime
member.summary: Fields whose values are marshalled to unmanaged arrays, must specify the size of the array at compile time since there is no place in the unmanaged array for the marshaller to store the number of elements.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MarshallingInformationIsInvalid
member.summary: IMarshallingInformation.{0} has an invalid value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MayNotOverrideInaccessibleMethod
member.summary: The method being implemented by an explicit override is not visible to the class doing the overriding, which is not allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MemberDisagreesAboutContainer
member.summary: This member definition thinks its containing definition is a different object than the one listing it as a member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MetadataConstantTypeMismatch
member.summary: This metadata constant value has a type that is incompatible with the type of the field, parameter or property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodGenericTypeParameterCountMismatch
member.summary: The value of GenericParameterCount does not match the number of parameters in the GenericParameters collection of the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodMarkedAsHavingDeclarativeSecurityHasNoSecurityAttributes
member.summary: This method definition is marked has having declarative security, but it has no security attributes and no SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodsCalledWithExplicitThisParametersMustNotBeStatic
member.summary: A method that are called with an explicit this parameter (via a function pointer) must actually have a this parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodCannotBeAnOverride
member.summary: This method is not virtual, or it has no body, so it cannot serve as the explicit override or implementation of a base class or interface method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodsNamedLikeConstructorsMustBeMarkedAsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: A method named .ctor or .cctor must also be marked as special name and runtime special.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodParameterCountDoesNotAgreeWithTheActualNumberOfParameters
member.summary: The value of ParameterCount does not match the number of parameters in the Parameters collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.MethodWithSecurityAttributesMustBeMarkedAsHavingDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: The method definition is not marked as having declarative security, but it has security attributes or a SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NamedArgumentNameDoesNotMatchNameOfResolvedFieldOrProperty
member.summary: The named argument's name does not match the name of the field or property that the argument resolves to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NamedArgumentTypeDoesNotMatchTypeOfResolvedFieldOrProperty
member.summary: The named argument's Type does not match the Type of the field or property that the argument resolves to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NonPublicTypeAlias
member.summary: A can only be aliased (exported) if it is public.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NonStaticPlatformInvokeMethod
member.summary: This method has platform invoke information but it is not marked as static.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NotPosixAssemblyName
member.summary: The assembly name "{0}" is not POSIX compliant because it contains a colon, forward-slash, backslash, or period.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NotPosixName
member.summary: The name "{0}" is not POSIX compliant because it contains a colon, forward-slash, backslash.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.NumberOfElementsSpecifiedExplicitlyAsWellAsByAParameter
member.summary: The size of the array passed in this parameter is specified explicitly as well as via another (size) parameter. This is probably a mistake.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.OnlySequentialLayoutTypesCanSpecificyAlignment
member.summary: Only types that have LayoutKind set to SequentialLayout are permitted to specify a non zero value for Alignment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ParameterCannotBeMarshalledAsByValArray
member.summary: Only field values can be marshalled as ByVal (fixed length) arrays.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ParameterIndexIsInvalid
member.summary: The index of the parameter to contain the size of the variable portion of an array that is marshalled as an unmanaged array is out of range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ParameterMarshalledArraysMustHaveSizeKnownAtCompileTime
member.summary: Parameters whose values are marshalled to unmanaged arrays and for which the marshalling information does not specify a parameter to convey the number of array elements, must specify the size of the array at compile time since there is no place in the unmanaged array for the marshaller to store the number of elements.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ReferenceToTypeAlias
member.summary: Imported type aliases may not appear directly in the metadata model. Instead refer to the aliased type via the value of the IAliasForType.AliasedType property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.ReferenceToTypeMemberWithOtherVisibility
member.summary: The given type member reference resolves to a type member (i.e. method or field) that has Other visibility (visible only to the compiler). Such members cannot be referenced across modules and intra module references must use the definitions directly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.RuntimeSpecialMustAlsoBeSpecialName
member.summary: A RuntimeSpecial member must also have its SpecialName flag set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SealedNewSlotOrOverrideMethodsMustAlsoBeVirtual
member.summary: It only makes sense to mark a method as sealed, new slot or access checked on override, if the method is virtual.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SecurityActionMismatch
member.summary: The security action of the security attribute is not compatible with the definition to which the attribute is applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SecurityAttributeOnInterface
member.summary: Security attributes on interfaces are ignored by the security system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SelfReference
member.summary: An assembly may not reference the file that contains the assembly's manifest module (the one being analyzed).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SingleFileAssemblyHasExportedTypes
member.summary: A single file assembly may not explicitly export types. The public types of the manifest module of any assembly are exported by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SpecialMethodsMayNotHaveCompilerControlledVisibility
member.summary: A method marked as SpecialName or as RuntimeSpecial may not be visible only to the compiler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StaticConstructorMayNotHaveParameters
member.summary: A static constructor may not have any parameters since it is invoked implicitly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StaticConstructorMustBeStatic
member.summary: Uhm, a static constructor (a method with the name .cctor) must be marked as being static, because well, its a static constructor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StaticFieldsMayNotHaveLayout
member.summary: A static field should not have layout information since it does not contribute to the layout of its containing type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StaticMethodMayNotBeSealedVirtualOrNewSlot
member.summary: A static method may not be marked as sealed, virtual, new slot.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StructsSizeMustBeLessThanOneMegaByte
member.summary: The given size, {0}, is too large for a value type (struct). The size must be less than 1 MByte (0x100000).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.StructSizeMustBeNonZero
member.summary: A struct must have a positive size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.SynchronizedValueTypeMethod
member.summary: A method defined by a value type operates on an object without identity, therefore it makes no sense to mark it as synchronized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.TypeReferenceResolvesToDifferentType
member.summary: Resolving the type reference results in a type with a different InternedKey from the type reference and no aliasing is involved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.TypeReferenceResolvesToDifferentTypeFromAlias
member.summary: Resolving the type reference results in a type with a different InternedKey from the resolved value of the TypeAlias property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.UnexpectedAliasMember
member.summary: This type alias member is not itself a nested type alias.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataError.UnknownAssemblyFlags
member.summary: The assembly's Flags property has bits set that are not valid according to the specification.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Error information relating to a node in a metadata model.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.ErrorReporter
member.summary: The object reporting the error. This can be used to filter out errors coming from non interesting sources.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.ErrorReporterIdentifier
member.summary: A short identifier for the reporter of the error, suitable for use in human interfaces. For example "CS" in the case of a C# language error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.Error
member.summary: The error this message pertains to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.Code
member.summary: A code that corresponds to this error. This code is the same for all cultures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.IsWarning
member.summary: True if the error message should be treated as an informational warning rather than as an indication that the associated compilation has failed and no useful executable output has been generated. The value of this property does not depend solely on this.Code but can be influenced by compiler options such as the csc /warnaserror option.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.Message
member.summary: A description of the error suitable for user interaction. Localized to the current culture.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.MessageParameter
member.summary: If not null, this strings parameterizes the error message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.Location
member.summary: The location of the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.ErrorMessage.RelatedLocations
member.summary: Zero ore more locations that are related to this error.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataNode
member.summary: Provides information about a location (node) in a metadata.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataNode.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataNode.Document
member.summary: The document containing this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataNode.Node
member.summary: A Metadata model object instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataDocument
member.summary: An object that projects an IModule instance as a "document" for the purposes of error reporting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataDocument.Module
member.summary: The metadata module. Could also be an assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataDocument.Location
member.summary: The location of the module that is invalid. For example a file system path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataValidator.MetadataDocument.Name
member.summary: The name of the module.
